Under what excitation wavelengths do RhB+@LIFM-WZ-6, BR-2+@LIFM-WZ-6, and APFG+@LIFM-WZ-6 exhibit up-conversion TPA white light?
True or False: The TPEF of RhB+@LIFM-WZ-6 (0.05 wt %) reveals dual emissions under the excitation of 730 nm.

True or False: The quantum yields of BR-2+@LIFM-WZ-6 (2 wt %) and APFG+@LIFM-WZ-6 (0.1 wt %) are 6.8 % and 7.1 %, respectively.
What is the CCT value of APFG+@LIFM-WZ-6 (0.1 wt %) under 365 nm excitation?
True or False: The emission color of dyes@LIFM-WZ-6 can be adjusted by changing the excitation wavelength.
What is the maximum TPACS value of LIFM-WZ-6 when excited with 820 nm?
True or False: The fluorescence performances of the white-emitting phosphors change significantly after being heated to 350 K for several hours.
What is the role of the uncoordinated triazole groups in the adsorption of cationic dyes by LIFM-WZ-6?
data.answer: They serve as the electron donor.

data.question: True or False: The LIFM-WZ-6 framework collapses in pure water.
What is the main advantage of two-photon excited emission (TPEF) over one-photon absorption (OPA) process?
data.answer: TPEF has deeper tissue penetration and reduced autofluorescence.

data.question: What is the main challenge in achieving reliable TPEF white light as mentioned in the text?
data.answer: It is difficult to control and predict the balance between energy transfer and spectral modulation among different components under TPA process.

data.question: True or False: The emission intensity of LIFM-WZ-6 decreases when the amounts of encapsulated RhB+ in the framework are increased.
